page.title: 08Farming (2)
page.content: Hungerhill Farm (500 acres) on B.2139 has an internationally known herd, the Hungerhill Highland Fold, largest in the south of England. The owner, Mrs McPhail, is a principal breeder of the cattle in this country, a major prize- winner at Agricultural Shows, and a highly esteemed judge. She exports widely to Europe. This year she has bred what is thought to be the first white (not albino) Highland heifer calf. With the Highland fold of about 95 is a pedigree Friesian dairy herd of 140. The farm is on 90% Wealden clay; 40% of the pasture is down to winter wheat; 20% to spring wheat, 20-25% to barley, the rest oats. The farmhouse, probably 16th C, with Horsham slab stone roof, has ancient yews and acacia trees in its pleasure gardens, with avenues of trees. An old stone quarry once yielded winklestone.
